channel.title: Half-Life stuff that few to none has heard of
channel.description:
I've decided to try and collect old Half-Life stuff that many's forgotten about, or never even heard of.
So far I've found these:[/SIZE] Half-Life: Further Data[/SIZE] Contains player models, sprays and maps that have not been included in the steam release. [url='https://half-life.wikia.com/wiki/Half-Life:_Further_Data']Overwiki Entry[/url] [url='https://www.halflifeuplink.com/furtherdata/']Download[/url] [img]https://img231.imageshack.us/img231/7274/tmcm.png[/img]
Half-Life: Day One[/SIZE] Demo. Contains the first part of the game, (that is maps, sprites, models etc.) Although it's pretty much the same, there are quite a few differences. [url='https://half-life.wikia.com/wiki/Half-Life:_Day_One']Overwiki Entry[/url] [url='https://www.gamefront.com/files/9563068/Half_Life_Day_One_Demo']Download[/url] [img]https://img402.imageshack.us/img402/3428/headcrabu.png[/img]
Half-Life: Uplink[/SIZE] Demo. Singleplayer maps based on a cut part of the game. [url='https://half-life.wikia.com/wiki/Uplink']Overwiki Entry[/url] [url='https://planethalflife.gamespy.com/View.php?view=HLFiles.Detail&id=1931']Download[/url]
Half-Life Preliminary Findings[/SIZE] Gameplay footage and interviews. [url='https://half-life.wikia.com/wiki/Half-Life_Preliminary_Findings']Overwiki Entry[/url] [url='https://forums.blackmesasource.com/showthread.php?t=9645']Download[/url]
Intro Map[/SIZE] Old intro map starring Mr. Valve, their mascot. [url='https://half-life.wikia.com/wiki/Mr_Valve#A_GoldSrc_demo']Overwiki Entry[/url] [url='https://hlbeta.ucoz.com/load/half_life_beta/general_content/the_lost_valve_intro/2-1-0-5']Download[/url]
Here's what I'm working on:[/SIZE] Half-Life SDK[/SIZE] Exactly what it says on the tin. Contains decompiled models of stuff already in the game (might contain secrets, like unused animations and so forth), but also the charger and panthereye. I've tried to compile them myself, but there seems to be something missing on some of them. I'd like some help, because I believe this could be very interesting. For instance, the SDK contains a neat HD texture for the battery. [url='https://www.fileplanet.com/81535/download/Full-Half-Life-SDK-2.3']Download[/url]
Half-Life for the Dreamcast[/SIZE] Half-Life was supposed to be ported to the Dreamcast by Gearbox, the same people responsible for porting it to the Playstation. However, it was never released. The sounds are WAV, but unplayable by WAV players. The models use pvr textures instead of bmp textures and are all screwed up. It would be great if someone knew how to convert them. [url='https://forums.blackmesasource.com/showthread.php?t=9300']Download[/url]
Half-Life for the Playstation 2[/SIZE] I've never been a console guy, so I missed out on this one. It's not as easy as simply getting it, though. The maps are in BS2 format instead of BSP, the models are DOLs instead of MDLs and the sprites are SPZ instead of SPR. DOLs can be opened and converted with Jed's Half-Life Model Viewer, but the rest I don't know what to do about.
Feel free to come with suggestions, help and other feedback.

item.title: Half-Life stuff that few to none has heard of
item.dc:creator: Scorpion42
item.description:
sersoft:

it’s because back then they just wanted to fill up the 700mb CD, and when it came out on steam the top priority was fast download.

I have an mdf of the original WON cd (includes the music tracks)

I have the Bestseller Series CD and case. Includes an extremely stripped down Opposing Force Capture the Flag.

Read full topic

item.title: Half-Life stuff that few to none has heard of
item.dc:creator: MarshmallowRadiation
item.description:
Scorpion42:

Half-Life for the Dreamcast[/SIZE]
Half-Life was supposed to be ported to the Dreamcast by Gearbox, the same people responsible for porting it to the Playstation. However, it was never released. Somehow, Youtube user MarphitimusBlackimus has tracked down the game and released a few videos on the subject. I’ll try and get in contact with him.

See here: https://forums.blackmesasource.com/showthread.php?t=9300

Read full topic

item.title: Half-Life stuff that few to none has heard of
item.dc:creator: Scorpion42
item.description:
I’ve decided to try and collect old Half-Life stuff that many’s forgotten about, or never even heard of.

So far I’ve found these:[/SIZE]
Half-Life: Further Data[/SIZE]
Contains player models, sprays and maps that have not been included in the steam release.
Overwiki Entry
Download

Half-Life: Day One[/SIZE]
Demo. Contains the first part of the game, (that is maps, sprites, models etc.) Although it’s pretty much the same, there are quite a few differences.
Overwiki Entry
Download

Half-Life: Uplink[/SIZE]
Demo. Singleplayer maps based on a cut part of the game.
Overwiki Entry
Download

Half-Life Preliminary Findings[/SIZE]
Gameplay footage and interviews.
Overwiki Entry
Download

Intro Map[/SIZE]
Old intro map starring Mr. Valve, their mascot.
Overwiki Entry
Download

Here’s what I’m working on:[/SIZE]
Half-Life SDK[/SIZE]
Exactly what it says on the tin. Contains decompiled models of stuff already in the game (might contain secrets, like unused animations and so forth), but also the charger and panthereye. I’ve tried to compile them myself, but there seems to be something missing on some of them. I’d like some help, because I believe this could be very interesting. For instance, the SDK contains a neat HD texture for the battery.
Download

Half-Life for the Dreamcast[/SIZE]
Half-Life was supposed to be ported to the Dreamcast by Gearbox, the same people responsible for porting it to the Playstation. However, it was never released. The sounds are WAV, but unplayable by WAV players. The models use pvr textures instead of bmp textures and are all screwed up. It would be great if someone knew how to convert them.
Download

Half-Life for the Playstation 2[/SIZE]
I’ve never been a console guy, so I missed out on this one. It’s not as easy as simply getting it, though. The maps are in BS2 format instead of BSP, the models are DOLs instead of MDLs and the sprites are SPZ instead of SPR. DOLs can be opened and converted with Jed’s Half-Life Model Viewer, but the rest I don’t know what to do about.

Feel free to come with suggestions, help and other feedback.
